bioghist.p: Lefferts Augustine Loetscher (1904-1981) was Professor of American Church History at Princeton Seminary. He received his masters degree from the University of Pennsylvania in 1932, and a doctorate in Divinity from University of Dubuque. He served in pastorates in Reading and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. His father, Frederick W. Loetscher, was also a Princeton historian.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Lefferts Augustine Loetscher. The papers concern the legal issues surrounding Church property rights. Included are legal files (briefs, correspondence, handwritten notes, and reports) related to the "Kaseman Case" (Rankin v. National Capital Union Presbytery) and the Walter Wynn Kenyon case. The collection also includes copies of published minutes and reports of various committees on the topic of church property; copies of Loetscher's "Implications of Presbyterian Theology and Polity for the Holding of Presbyterian Ecclesiastical Property"; and notes for an article published in Presbyterian Outlook on Presbyterian Church property.
